00051 
00052 ## @brief The Screen class is a widget that provides an easy way of handling multiple views.
00053 #
00054 # This class is capable of managing various views of the same model and provides
00055 # functions for moving to the next and previous record.
00056 #
00057 # If neither setViewTypes() nor setViewIds() are called, form and tree views (in this order)
00058 # will be used. If you use only a single 'id' and say it's a 'tree', one you try to switchView
00059 # the default 'form' view will be shown. If you only want to show the 'tree' view, use 
00060 # setViewTypes( [] ) or setViewTypes( ['tree'] )
00061 # When you add a new view by it's ID the type of the given view is removed from the list of
00062 # view types. (See: addViewById() )
00063 #
00064 class Screen(QScrollArea):
00065 
00066         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00067                 QScrollArea.__init__(self, parent)
00068                 self.setFocusPolicy( Qt.NoFocus )
00069 
00070                 # GUI Stuff
00071                 self.setFrameShape( QFrame.NoFrame )
00072                 self.setWidgetResizable( True )
00073                 self.container = QWidget( self )
00074                 self.setWidget( self.container )
00075 
00076                 self.container.show()
00077 
00078                 self.searchForm = SearchFormWidget(self.container)
00079                 self.connect( self.searchForm, SIGNAL('search()'), self.search )
00080                 self.connect( self.searchForm, SIGNAL('keyDownPressed()'), self.setFocusToView )
00081                 self.searchForm.hide()
00082                 self.containerView = None
00083 
00084                 self.toolBar = ToolBar(self)
00085                 self.toolBar.hide()
00086 
00087                 self.layout = QHBoxLayout()
00088                 self.layout.setSpacing( 0 )
00089                 self.layout.setContentsMargins( 0, 0, 0, 0 )
00090                 self.layout.addWidget( self.toolBar )
00091 
00092                 vLay = QVBoxLayout( self.container )
00093                 vLay.setContentsMargins( 0, 0, 0, 0 )
00094                 vLay.addWidget( self.searchForm )
00095                 vLay.addLayout( self.layout )
00096 
00097                 # Non GUI Stuff
00098                 self.actions = []
00099 
00100                 self._embedded = True
00101 
00102                 self.views_preload = {}
00103                 self.rpc = None
00104                 self.name = None
00105                 self.views = {}
00106                 self.fields = {}
00107                 self.group = None
00108                 self._currentRecordPosition = None
00109                 self._currentRecord = None
00110                 self._currentView = -1
00111                 self._previousView = -1
00112 
00113                 self._viewQueue = ViewQueue()
00114 
00115         def setFocusToView(self):
00116                 self.currentView().setFocus()
00117 
00118         def sizeHint(self):
00119                 return self.container.sizeHint()
00120 
00121         def setPreloadedViews(self, views):
00122                 self.views_preload = views
00123 
00124         def preloadedViews(self, views):
00125                 return self.views_preload
00126                 
00127         def setupViews(self, types, ids):
00128                 self._viewQueue.setup( types, ids )
00129                 # Try to load only if model group has been set
00130                 if self.name:
00131                         self.switchView()
00132 
00133         def setViewIds(self, ids):
00134                 self._viewQueue.setViewIds( ids )
00135                 # Try to load only if model group has been set
00136                 if self.name:
00137                         self.switchView()
00138 
00139         def viewIds(self):
00140                 return self._viewIds
00141 
00142         def setViewTypes(self, types):
00143                 self._viewQueue.setViewTypes( types )
00144                 # Try to load only if model group has been set
00145                 if self.name:
00146                         self.switchView()
00147 
00148         ## @brief Sets whether the screen is embedded.
00149         #
00150         # Embedded screens don't show the search or toolbar widgets.
00151         # By default embedded is True so it doesn't load unnecessary forms.
00152         def setEmbedded(self, value):
00153                 self._embedded = value
00154                 self.setToolbarVisible( not value )
00155                 self.setSearchFormVisible( not value )
00156 
00157         ## @brief Returns True if the Screen acts in embedded mode.
00158         def embedded(self):
00159                 return self._embedded
00160 
00161         def setToolbarVisible(self, value):
00162                 self._toolbarVisible = value
00163                 self.toolBar.setVisible( value )
00164 
00165         def setSearchFormVisible(self, value):
00166                 self._searchFormVisible = value
00167                 self.searchForm.setVisible( value )
00168                 if value:
00169                         if self.currentView() and self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00170                                 self.loadSearchForm()
00171 
00172         def loadSearchForm(self):
00173                 if self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords() and not self._embedded: 
00174                         if not self.searchForm.isLoaded():
00175                                 form = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.resource, 'fields_view_get', False, 'form', self.context)
00176                                 self.searchForm.setup( form['arch'], form['fields'], self.resource )
00177 
00178                         if self.searchForm.isEmpty():
00179                                 self.searchForm.hide()
00180                         else:
00181                                 self.searchForm.show()
00182                 else:
00183                         self.searchForm.hide()
00184 
00185         def triggerAction(self):
00186                 # We expect a Screen.Action here
00187                 action = self.sender()
00188 
00189                 # Do not trigger action if there is no record selected. This is
00190                 # only permitted for plugins.
00191                 if not self.currentId() and action.type() != 'plugin':
00192                         return
00193 
00194                 id = self.currentId()
00195                 ids = self.selectedIds()
00196 
00197                 if action.type() != 'relate':
00198                         self.save()
00199                         self.display()
00200 
00201                 action.execute( id, ids )
00202 
00203                 if action.type() != 'relate':
00204                         self.reload()
00205 
00206         ## @brief Sets the current widget of the Screen
00207         def setView(self, widget):
00208                 if self.containerView:
00209                         self.disconnect(self.containerView, SIGNAL("activated()"), self.activate )
00210                         self.disconnect(self.containerView, SIGNAL("currentChanged(PyQt_PyObject)"), self.currentChanged)
00211                         self.containerView.hide()
00212 
00213                 self.containerView = widget
00214                 # Calling first "loadSearchForm()" because when the search form is hidden
00215                 # it looks better to the user. If we show the widget and then hide the search
00216                 # form it produces an ugly flickering.
00217                 self.loadSearchForm()
00218                 widget.show()
00219                 self.connect(widget, SIGNAL("activated()"), self.activate )
00220                 self.connect(widget, SIGNAL("currentChanged(PyQt_PyObject)"), self.currentChanged)
00221 
00222                 # Set focus proxy so other widgets can try to setFocus to us
00223                 # and the focus is set to the expected widget.
00224                 self.setFocusProxy( self.containerView )
00225 
00226                 self.layout.insertWidget( 0, widget )
00227                 self.ensureWidgetVisible( widget )
00228 
00229         def activate( self ):
00230                 self.emit( SIGNAL('activated()') )
00231 
00232         def close( self ):
00233                 self.emit( SIGNAL('closed()') )
00234 
00235         ## @brief Searches with the current parameters of the search form and loads the
00236         # models that fit the criteria.
00237         def search( self ):
00238                 value = self.searchForm.value()
00239                 self.group.setFilter( value )
00240                 self.group.update()
00241                 if self.group.count() > 0:
00242                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( 0 ) )
00243                 else:
00244                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00245                 self.display()
00246 
00247         # Slot to recieve the signal from a view when the current item changes
00248         def currentChanged(self, model):
00249                 self.setCurrentRecord( model )
00250                 self.emit( SIGNAL('currentChanged()') )
00251 
00252         ## @brief Sets the RecordGroup this Screen should show.
00253         # @param group RecordGroup object.
00254         def setRecordGroup(self, group):
00255                 if not group:
00256                         self.group = None
00257                         self._currentRecord = None
00258                         self._currentRecordPosition = None
00259                         # Call setCurrentRecord() after setting self.group
00260                         # because it will emit a signal with the count of elements
00261                         # which must be 0.
00262                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00263                         return
00264 
00265                 self.name = group.resource
00266                 self.resource = group.resource
00267                 self.context = group.context()
00268                 self.rpc = RpcProxy(self.resource)
00269 
00270                 self.group = group
00271                 self._currentRecord = None
00272                 self._currentRecordPosition = None
00273 
00274                 group.addFields(self.fields)
00275                 self.fields.update(group.fields)
00276 
00277         ## @brief Returns a reference the current record (Record).
00278         def currentRecord(self):
00279                 # Checking _currentRecordPosition before count() can save a search() call to the server because
00280                 # count() will execute a search() in the server if no items have been loaded yet. What happens is
00281                 # that the first time a screen with a TreeView is shown currentRecord() will be called but there
00282                 # will be no currentRecord. TreeView then will set the appropiate order by loading settings from 
00283                 # the server through restoreViewSettings, and KooModel will load data on demand.
00284                 if self._currentRecordPosition >= 0 and self.group.count():
00285                         # Use modelByIndex because this ensures all missing fields of the model
00286                         # are loaded. For example, the model could have been loaded in tree view
00287                         # but now might need more fields for form view.
00288                         return self.group.modelByIndex( self._currentRecordPosition )
00289                 else:
00290                         # New records won't have that problem (althouth the problem might be that
00291                         # fields haven't been created yet??)
00292                         return self._currentRecord
00293 
00294         ## @brief Sets the current record.
00295         #
00296         # Note that value will be a reference to the Record.
00297         def setCurrentRecord(self, value):
00298                 self._currentRecord = value
00299                 if self.group and self.group.recordExists( value ):
00300                         pos = self.group.indexOfRecord( value )
00301                 else:
00302                         pos = -1
00303                 self._currentRecordPosition = pos
00304                 if value and value.id:
00305                         id = value.id
00306                 else:
00307                         id = -1
00308                 if self.group:
00309                         count = self.group.count()
00310                 else:
00311                         count = 0
00312                 self.emit(SIGNAL('recordMessage(int,int,int)'), pos, count, id)
00313                 if self._currentRecord:
00314                         if self.currentView():
00315                                 self.currentView().setSelected(self._currentRecord.id)
00316 
00317         ## @brief Switches to the next view in the queue of views.
00318         def switchView(self, viewType = None):
00319                 if self.currentView(): 
00320                         self.currentView().store()
00321 
00322                 if self.currentRecord() and ( not self.group.recordExists( self.currentRecord() ) ):
00323                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00324 
00325                 if viewType:
00326                         self._previousView = self._currentView
00327                         self._currentView = self._viewQueue.indexFromType( viewType )
00328                 else:
00329                         if self._currentView >= 0:
00330                                 # Swap currentView and previousView values
00331                                 self._currentView, self._previousView = self._previousView, self._currentView
00332                         else:
00333                                 self._currentView = 0
00334                         # The second time switchView is executed, currentView might get -1
00335                         # and we want it in fact to be 1 ...
00336                         self._currentView = abs(self._currentView)
00337                         # ... unless there's only one view
00338                         self._currentView = min(self._currentView, self._viewQueue.count()-1)
00339 
00340                 self.setView( self.currentView() )
00341                 if self.currentRecord():
00342                         self.currentRecord().setValidate()
00343                 self.display()
00344 
00345         ## @brief Loads the next view pending to be loaded.
00346         # If there is no view pending it returns False, otherwise returns True.
00347         def loadNextView(self):
00348                 if self._viewQueue.isEmpty():
00349                         return False
00350 
00351                 (id, type) = self._viewQueue.next()
00352                 self.addViewByIdAndType( id, type )
00353                 return True
00354 
00355 
00356         ## @brief Adds a view given it's id and type.
00357         #
00358         # This function is needed to resemble server's fields_view_get function. This 
00359         # function wasn't necessary but accounting module needs it because it tries to
00360         # open a view with it's ID but reimplements fields_view_get and checks the view
00361         # type.
00362         #
00363         # @see AddViewById
00364         # @see AddViewByType
00365         def addViewByIdAndType(self, id, type, display=False):
00366                 if type in self.views_preload:
00367                         return self.addView(self.views_preload[type]['arch'], self.views_preload[type]['fields'], display, toolbar=self.views_preload[type].get('toolbar', False), id=self.views_preload[type].get('view_id',False))
00368                 else:
00369                         # By now we set toolbar to True always. Even when the Screen is embedded.
00370                         # This way we don't force setting the embedded option in the class constructor
00371                         # and can be set later.
00372                         view = self.rpc.fields_view_get(id, type, self.context, True)
00373                         return self.addView(view['arch'], view['fields'], display, toolbar=view.get('toolbar', False), id=view['view_id'])
00374                 
00375         ## @brief Adds a view given its id.
00376         # @param id View id to load or False if you want to load given view_type.
00377         # @param display Whether you want the added view to be shown (True) or only loaded (False).
00378         # @return The view widget
00379         # 
00380         # @see AddViewByType
00381         # @see AddViewByIdAndType
00382         def addViewById(self, id, display=False):
00383                 # By now we set toolbar to True always. Even when the Screen is embedded.
00384                 # This way we don't force setting the embedded option in the class constructor
00385                 # and can be set later.
00386                 view = self.rpc.fields_view_get(id, False, self.context, True)
00387                 return self.addView(view['arch'], view['fields'], display, toolbar=view.get('toolbar', False), id=id)
00388                 
00389         ## @brief Adds a view given a view type.
00390         # @param type View type ('form', 'tree', 'calendar', 'graph'...). 
00391         # @param display Whether you want the added view to be shown (True) or only loaded (False).
00392         # @return The view widget
00393         #
00394         # @see AddViewById
00395         # @see AddViewByIdAndType
00396         def addViewByType(self, type, display=False):
00397                 if type in self.views_preload:
00398                         return self.addView(self.views_preload[type]['arch'], self.views_preload[type]['fields'], display, toolbar=self.views_preload[type].get('toolbar', False), id=self.views_preload[type].get('view_id',False))
00399                 else:
00400                         # By now we set toolbar to True always. Even when the Screen is embedded.
00401                         # This way we don't force setting the embedded option in the class constructor
00402                         # and can be set later.
00403                         view = self.rpc.fields_view_get(False, type, self.context, True)
00404                         return self.addView(view['arch'], view['fields'], display, toolbar=view.get('toolbar', False), id=view['view_id'])
00405                 
00406         ## @brief Adds a view given it's XML description and fields
00407         # @param arch XML string: typically 'arch' field returned by model fields_view_get() function.
00408         # @param fields Fields dictionary containing each field (widget) properties.
00409         # @param display Whether you want the added view to be shown (True) or only loaded (False)
00410         # @param toolbar Toolbar information as returned from fields_view_get server function.
00411         # @param id View id. This parameter is used for storing and loading settings for the view. If id=False, no
00412         #               settings will be stored/loaded.
00413         # @return The view widget
00414         def addView(self, arch, fields, display=False, toolbar={}, id=False):
00415                 def _parse_fields(node, fields):
00416                         if node.nodeType == node.ELEMENT_NODE:
00417                                 if node.localName=='field':
00418                                         attrs = Common.nodeAttributes(node)
00419                                         if attrs.get('widget', False):
00420                                                 if attrs['widget']=='one2many_list':
00421                                                         attrs['widget']='one2many'
00422                                                 attrs['type'] = attrs['widget']
00423                                         try:
00424                                                 fields[attrs['name']].update(attrs)
00425                                         except:
00426                                                 print "-"*30,"\n malformed tag for :", attrs
00427                                                 print "-"*30
00428                                                 raise                                           
00429                         for node2 in node.childNodes:
00430                                 _parse_fields(node2, fields)
00431                 dom = xml.dom.minidom.parseString(arch.encode('utf-8'))
00432                 _parse_fields(dom, fields)
00433 
00434                 self.group.addFields(fields)
00435 
00436                 self.fields = self.group.fields
00437 
00438                 dom = xml.dom.minidom.parseString(arch.encode('utf-8'))
00439                 view = ViewFactory.create(id, self, self.resource, dom, self.fields)
00440                 self.setOnWriteFunction( view.onWriteFunction() )
00441                 # Load view settings
00442                 view.setViewSettings( ViewSettings.load( view.id ) )
00443 
00444                 self.views[ view.viewType() ] = view
00445                 self.loadActions( toolbar )
00446 
00447                 if display:
00448                         if not self._viewQueue.typeExists( view.viewType() ):
00449                                 self._viewQueue.addViewType( view.viewType() )
00450                         self._currentView = self._viewQueue.indexFromType( view.viewType() )
00451                         self.currentView().display(self.currentRecord(), self.group)
00452                         self.setView(view)
00453                 return view
00454 
00455         ## @brief Loads all actions associated with the current model including plugins.
00456         def loadActions( self, actions ):
00457                 self.actions = ActionFactory.create( self, actions, self.resource )
00458                 if self.actions:
00459                         for action in self.actions:
00460                                 self.connect( action, SIGNAL('triggered()'), self.triggerAction )
00461                         # If there's only one action it will be the 'Print Screen' action
00462                         # that is added "manually" by ActionFactory. In those cases in which
00463                         # Print Screen is the only action we won't show it in the toolbar. We
00464                         # don't consider Plugins a good reason to show the toolbar either.
00465                         # This way dashboards won't show the toolbar, though the option will
00466                         # remain available in the menu for those screens that don't have any
00467                         # actions configured in the server, but Print Screen can be useful.
00468                         if len(self.actions) > 1 + len(Plugins.list(self.resource)) and Options.options['show_toolbar']:
00469                                 self.toolBar.setup( self.actions )
00470 
00471         ## @brief Returns True if the current view is read-only. Returns False if it's read-write.
00472         def isReadOnly(self):
00473                 return self.currentView().isReadOnly()
00474 
00475         def new(self, default=True):
00476                 if self.currentView() and self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords() \
00477                                 and self.currentView().isReadOnly():
00478                         self.switchView()
00479 
00480                 record = self.group.create( default, self.newRecordPosition(), self.group.domain(), self.context )
00481 
00482                 if self.currentView():
00483                         self.currentView().reset()
00484 
00485                 self.setCurrentRecord( record )
00486                 self.display()
00487 
00488                 if self.currentView():
00489                         self.currentView().startEditing()
00490                 return self.currentRecord()
00491 
00492         def newRecordPosition(self):
00493                 if self.currentView() and self.currentView().addOnTop():
00494                         return 0
00495                 else:
00496                         return -1 
00497 
00498         def setOnWriteFunction(self, functionName):
00499                 self.group.setOnWriteFunction( functionName )
00500 
00501         ## @brief Stores all modified models.
00502         def save(self):
00503                 if not self.currentRecord():
00504                         return False
00505                 self.currentView().store()
00506                 
00507                 id = False
00508                 if self.currentRecord().validate():
00509                         id = self.currentRecord().save(reload=True)
00510                 else:
00511                         self.currentView().display(self.currentRecord(), self.group)
00512                         return False
00513                 
00514                 if self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00515                         for record in self.group.modifiedRecords():
00516                                 if record.validate():
00517                                         id = record.save(reload=True)
00518                                 else:
00519                                         self.setCurrentRecord( record )
00520                                         self.display()
00521                                         return False
00522                         self.display()
00523 
00524                 self.display()
00525                 return id
00526 
00527         ## @brief Reloads 
00528         def reload(self):
00529                 if not self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00530                         if self.currentRecord():
00531                                 self.currentRecord().reload()
00532                                 self.display()
00533                         return
00534 
00535                 id = 0
00536                 idx = -1
00537                 if self.currentRecord():
00538                         id = self.currentId()
00539                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord(self.currentRecord())
00540                         
00541                 self.group.update()
00542                 if id:
00543                         record = self.group.modelById( id )
00544                         
00545                         if record:
00546                                 self.setCurrentRecord( record )
00547                         else:
00548                                 # If what it was the current record no longer exists
00549                                 # at least keep index position
00550                                 idx = min( idx, self.group.count() - 1 )
00551                                 if idx >= 0:
00552                                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( idx ) )
00553                                 else:
00554                                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00555                 else:
00556                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00557                 self.display()
00558 
00559         ## @brief Removes all new records and marks all modified ones as not loaded.
00560         def cancel(self):
00561                 idx = -1
00562                 if self.currentRecord():
00563                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord( self.currentRecord() )
00564                         
00565                 self.group.cancel()
00566                 if idx != -1:
00567                         idx = min( idx, self.group.count() - 1 )
00568                         if idx >= 0:
00569                                 self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( idx ) )
00570                         else:
00571                                 self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00572                         self.display()
00573 
00574         ## @brief Returns a reference to the current view.
00575         def currentView(self):
00576                 if self._currentView < 0:
00577                         return None
00578                 type = self._viewQueue.typeFromIndex( self._currentView )
00579                 if not type in self.views:
00580                         (id, type) = self._viewQueue.viewFromType( type )
00581                         self.addViewByIdAndType( id, type )
00582                 return self.views[ type ]
00583 
00584         ## @brief Returns a dictionary with all field values for the current record. 
00585         def get(self):
00586                 if not self.currentRecord():
00587                         return None
00588                 self.currentView().store()
00589                 return self.currentRecord().get()
00590 
00591         ## @brief Returns True if any record has been modified. Returns False otherwise.
00592         def isModified(self):
00593                 if not self.currentRecord():
00594                         return False
00595                 self.currentView().store()
00596                 res = False
00597                 if self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00598                         return self.group.isModified()
00599                 else:
00600                         return self.currentRecord().isModified()
00601 
00602         ## @brief Removes all selected ids.
00603         #
00604         # If unlink is False (the default) records are only removed from the list. If
00605         # unlink is True records will be removed from the server too.
00606         def remove(self, unlink = False):
00607                 ids = self.selectedIds()
00608                 if unlink and ids:
00609                         # Remove records with id None as they would cause an exception
00610                         # trying to remove from the server 
00611                         idsToUnlink = [x for x in ids if x != None]
00612                         # It could be that after removing records with id == None
00613                         # there are no records to remove from the database. That is,
00614                         # all records that should be removed are new and not stored yet.
00615                         if idsToUnlink:
00616                                 unlinked = self.rpc.unlink( idsToUnlink )       
00617                                 # Try to be consistent with database
00618                                 # If records could not be removed from the database
00619                                 # don't remove them on the client. Don't report it directly
00620                                 # though as probably an exception (Warning) has already
00621                                 # been shown to the user.
00622                                 if not unlinked:
00623                                         return False
00624                 for x in ids:
00625                         model = self.group[x]
00626                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord( model )
00627                         self.group.remove( model )
00628                         if self.group.count():
00629                                 idx = min(idx, self.group.count() - 1)
00630                                 self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( idx ) )
00631                         else:
00632                                 self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00633                 self.display()
00634                 if ids:
00635                         return True
00636                 else:
00637                         return False
00638 
00639         def load(self, ids):
00640                 self.currentView().reset()
00641                 self.group.load( ids, display =True )
00642                 if ids:
00643                         self.display(ids[0])
00644                 else:
00645                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00646                         self.display()
00647 
00648         ## @brief Displays the record with id 'id' or refreshes the current record if 
00649         # no id is given.
00650         def display(self, id=None):
00651                 if id:
00652                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group[id] )
00653                 if self.views:
00654                         self.currentView().display(self.currentRecord(), self.group)
00655 
00656         ## @brief Moves current record to the next one in the list and displays it in the 
00657         # current view.
00658         def displayNext(self):
00659                 self.currentView().store()
00660                 if self.group.recordExists( self.currentRecord() ):
00661                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord(self.currentRecord())
00662                         idx = (idx+1) % self.group.count()
00663                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.modelByIndex(idx) )
00664                 else:
00665                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.count() and self.group.modelByIndex(0) )
00666                 if self.currentRecord():
00667                         self.currentRecord().setValidate()
00668                 self.display()
00669 
00670         ## @brief Moves current record to the previous one in the list and displays it in the 
00671         # current view.
00672         def displayPrevious(self):
00673                 self.currentView().store()
00674                 if self.group.recordExists( self.currentRecord() ):
00675                         #idx = self.group.records.index(self.currentRecord())-1
00676                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord(self.currentRecord())-1
00677                         if idx<0:
00678                                 idx = self.group.count()-1
00679                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.modelByIndex(idx) )
00680                 else:
00681                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.count() and self.group.modelByIndex(-1) )
00682 
00683                 if self.currentRecord():
00684                         self.currentRecord().setValidate()
00685                 self.display()
00686 
00687         ## @brief Returns all selected record ids.
00688         def selectedIds(self):
00689                 return self.currentView().selectedIds()
00690 
00691         ## @brief Returns the current record id.
00692         def currentId(self):
00693                 if self.currentRecord():
00694                         return self.currentRecord().id
00695                 else:
00696                         return None
00697 
00698         ## @brief Returns a list with all loaded (or preloaded) record ids.
00699         def allIds(self):
00700                 return [x.id for x in self.group if x.id]
00701 
00702         ## @brief Clears the list of records and refreshes the view.
00703         #
00704         # Note that this won't remove the records from the database. But clears
00705         # the records from the model. It means that sometimes you might want to
00706         # use setRecordGroup( None ) instead of calling clear(). This is what
00707         # OneToMany and ManyToMany widgets do, for example.
00708         # @see remove()
00709         def clear(self):
00710                 self.group.clear()
00711                 self.display()
00712 
00713         # Stores settings of all opened views
00714         def storeViewSettings(self):
00715                 for view in self.views.values():
00716                         ViewSettings.store( view.id, view.viewSettings() )
